ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Hello All
ygData.msgSnippet: Ooh, now there s an idea I d like to try! Thank you! luv, -Su
ygData.messageBody:
Ooh, now there's an idea I'd like to try! Thank you!
luv,
-Su

> I've found dungeons to be very different from each other. The one I
> won was a breeze, one death, the same group got creamed in another,
> with several deaths.
>
> One of my guild mates was in beta and said if the lowest level in the
> group get's the mission it's easier. It's worked twice!
>
> Tuldayen Grimblade
> Pathfinder of Tunare
> Summoners of the Realm, Terris-Thule
>
> --- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, Su <suceress@d...> wrote:
> > When the weather is better and I have a stable 'net connection I'll
> try
> > another dungeon crawl. As it is I have failed 4 or 5 times because
> of
> > running out of time.
> > The first dungeon crawl I did we made over 100pp each. Second one I
> got a
> > wisdom augmentation stone. Even though we didn't succeed we still
> had fun.
> > I hope that I can get grouped with some guildies sometime though.
> > luv,
> > -Su
> >
> > > I have been in a couple of guild adventures. It's not too hard to
> > > get 6 guildies together, but not all the time.
> > >
> > > And the main idea of all these adventures is to get to the named
> mob,
> > > because that is where the big drop is. Rangers and Druids have
> > > track, so once again we have a use. And that snare helps too when
> > > they go for friends!
> > >
> > > Tuldayen Grimblade
> > > Pathfinder of Tunare
> > > Summoners of the Realm, Terris-Thule
> > >
> > > --- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Dave Lyles" <dwlyles@h...>
> wrote:
> > > > I'm a level 41 Half Elf Druid. Like you, I have soloed most of
> my
> > > life. What I have found about LDoN is, true you have to group.
> But
> > > the organization is there, so that the groups constantly change.
> > > Most often I am asked to join by putting my LFG flag up. The
> > > adventures are short, 2 hrs and have a specific goal to obtain.
> The
> > > exp is great, typically half a level per adventure. We druids are
> > > popular for our regen buff and healing, and have counteract
> poison up
> > > if someone's gonna play with the crates. You can save yourself in
> > > time if your fast. Then, after 2 hrs, you split the loot,
> typically
> > > 50 - 80 plat your share, and go back to soloing. I thought it was
> > > more for guilds as well, but have yet to see a group of all one
> > > guild. I am typically quiet (I type slow, hehe) but so much goes
> on
> > > so fast, that nobody seems to mind.
> > > >
> > > > Tokool Espirit
> > > > Lany's server
> > > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > > From: mlockridge01
> > > > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > > > Sent: Sunday, September 21, 2003 1:03 AM
> > > > Subject: [EverQuest] Re: Hello All
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > I am a lvl 41 Halfling Druid. Haven't purchased LDoN yet, as I
> > > most
> > > > often play solo and don't know that I would use it. Have
> > > everything up
> > > > to this expansion, but am not convinced that it is worthwhile.
> > > Sounds
> > > > very nice, but I have had two guilds I have been a part of
> fade
> > > away,
> > > > and this sounds like something best suited to guilds.
> > > >
> > > > Barto Proudfoot
> > > > Zeb server
> > > >
> > > > --- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Masteradept"
> > > <masteradept007@y...>
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > I wanted to say Hello to all of my fellow addicts....Heya.
> My
> > > main
> > > > > is a 45th Halfling Druid on Kane Bayle. Unfourtantly I am
> in
> > > > > maryland and our power is out because of Isabella...(damn
> > > her). So
> > > > > I'm looking at stuff from work and wondering if anyone does
> not
> > > like
> > > > > LDoN? if so Why?
> > > > >
> > > > > Estro Runeweaver
